page.title: 17Wroxton Abbey 1933-1985
page.content: Up until 1933 the Abbey was the home of the Pope and North family. In 1963 the Abbey and 56 acres of grounds were bought by the Fairleigh Dickinson University of New Jersey U.S.A. It was in a very bad state of repair and had to undergo extensive repairs before it was ready to receive students in 1965. In 1973 the University received a gift of money which allowed it to convert the stable and carriage block into sleeping accommodation, kitchens and dining rooms. In 1975 a car park was created and in 1982 a lodge at the entrance to the Abbey was restored. From 1978 to 1982 150,000 pounds was spent on restoring the stonework, and re-roofing. This was paid for by the help of a 44% grant from the Historic Buildings Council.
